option.name: message
option.value:
### Kubernetes Deployment Timeout Analysis
**Issue Summary:** - Kubernetes deployment `customer-service-deployment` failed to complete rollout within timeout period - Deployment was stuck updating replicas (fluctuating between 0/3 and 2/3 updated) - Service configuration remained unchanged but pods failed to reach ready state
**Root Cause Analysis:** The deployment timeout indicates pods are failing readiness/liveness probes or experiencing resource constraints. Common causes include: - Container image pull failures or startup crashes - Insufficient CPU/memory resources - Failed health check endpoints - Network connectivity issues - Configuration errors in deployment manifest
**Troubleshooting Steps Performed:** 1. Applied deployment configuration successfully 2. Monitored rollout progress showing inconsistent replica updates 3. Deployment timed out after multiple retry attempts 4. Process terminated with exit code 1
**Next Actions Required:** - Check pod logs and events for specific error details - Verify resource quotas and node capacity - Validate container image availability and health check endpoints - Review deployment manifest for configuration issues
